1.text: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, Whose fathers I disdained to set with the dogs of my flock.

2.text: Yea, the strength of their hands, whereto should it profit me? Men in whom ripe age is perished.

3.text: They are gaunt with want and famine; They gnaw the dry ground, in the gloom of wasteness and desolation.

4.text: They pluck salt-wort by the bushes; And the roots of the broom are their food.

5.text: They are driven forth from the midst of men; They cry after them as after a thief;

6.text: So that they dwell in frightful valleys, In holes of the earth and of the rocks.

7.text: Among the bushes they bray; Under the nettles they are gathered together.

8.text: They are children of fools, yea, children of base men; They were scouraged out of the land.

9.text: And now I am become their song, Yea, I am a byword unto them.

10.text: They abhor me, they stand aloof from me, And spare not to spit in my face.

11.text: For he hath loosed his cord, and afflicted me; And they have cast off the bridle before me.

12.text: Upon my right hand rise the rabble; They thrust aside my feet, And they cast up against me their ways of destruction.

13.text: They mar my path, They set forward my calamity, Even men that have no helper.

14.text: As through a wide breach they come: In the midst of the ruin they roll themselves upon me.

15.text: Terrors are turned upon me; They chase mine honor as the wind; And my welfare is passed away as a cloud.

16.text: And now my soul is poured out within me; Days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

17.text: In the night season my bones are pierced in me, And the pains that gnaw me take no rest.

18.text: By Godâ€™s great force is my garment disfigured; It bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

19.text: He hath cast me into the mire, And I am become like dust and ashes.

20.text: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not answer me: I stand up, and thou gazest at me.

21.text: Thou art turned to be cruel to me; With the might of thy hand thou persecutest me.

22.text: Thou liftest me up to the wind, thou causest me to ride upon it; And thou dissolvest me in the storm.

23.text: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, And to the house appointed for all living.

24.text: Howbeit doth not one stretch out the hand in his fall? Or in his calamity therefore cry for help?

25.text: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? Was not my soul grieved for the needy?

26.text: When I looked for good, then evil came; And when I waited for light, there came darkness.

27.text: My heart is troubled, and resteth not; Days of affliction are come upon me.

28.text: I go mourning without the sun: I stand up in the assembly, and cry for help.

29.text: I am a brother to jackals, And a companion to ostriches.

30.text: My skin is black, and falleth from me, And my bones are burned with heat.

31.text: Therefore is my harp turned to mourning, And my pipe into the voice of them that weep.
